fr:mainmatter.fr:p:
The question is local on X. We can thus suppose that X is an open polycylinder D^m, with D = \{z\in \mathbb {C} \mid |z|<1\} and also that Y=\bigcup _{k=1}^\ell Y_k with Y_k=\operatorname {pr}_k^{-1}(0). The fibre at 0 of \mathrm {R}^nj_*\mathbb {Z} is then the integer cohomology of X^*=(D^*)^\ell \times D^{m-\ell }, with D^* = \{z\in \mathbb {C} \mid 0<|z|<1\}.
The space X^* has the homotopy type of a torus; its cohomology is thus torsion free, and the cup product defines isomorphisms \bigwedge ^n(\mathrm {R}^1j_*\mathbb {Z}) \xrightarrow {\sim } (\mathrm {R}^nj_*\mathbb {Z})_0. It thus suffices to prove for n=1.

The integer homology \operatorname {H}_1(X^*) is generated by the loops \gamma _k that go around the various Y_k. We have \oint _{\gamma _k} \frac {\mathrm {d} z_k}{z_k} = \pm 2\pi i and so the integer cohomology is generated by the \frac {1}{2\pi i}\frac {\mathrm {d} z_k}{z_k}, and this proves .
The canonical morphism from \mathrm {R}^nj_*\mathbb {Z} to \mathrm {R}^nj_*\mathbb {C} identifies, via , the sheaf \mathrm {R}^nj_*\mathbb {Z} with (\varepsilon _X^n)_\mathbb {Z} ().
